qas.question: What do Muslims believe that Trinitism too closely resembles?
Which belief is expected to never try and visualize God?
What is the most basic belief of the Muslim religion?
What religious text helps reinforce to Muslims that Christianity is more like polytheism?
What is the meaning behind the Muslim concept of tawhid?
What religion believes that all theist worship the same god?
What is the trinity in Christianity?
What do Muslims think of Christianity?
What are Christians not expected to do, since they are iconodules?

plausible_answers.text: all theists actually worship the same god, whether they know it or not

qas.question: What view about monotheists is emphasized by Islam?

plausible_answers.text: God as one God in three persons

qas.question: What does the Trinity doctrine describe according to theists?
What do Hindus compare the divinity of Jesus to?

plausible_answers.text: any of his creations in any way

qas.question: In Christianity what does Jesus not resemble?

context: Monotheists hold that there is only <a5_0>one god<a5_0/>, and may claim that the one true god is worshiped in different religions under different names. The view that <b10_0>all theists actually worship the same god, whether they know it or not<b10_0/>, is especially emphasized in <a6_0>Hinduism and Sikhism<a6_0/>. In Christianity, the doctrine of the Trinity describes <b11_0>God as <a7_0>one God in three persons<b11_0/><a7_0/>. The Trinity comprises God the Father, God the Son (Jesus), and God the Holy Spirit. Islam's most fundamental concept is <a2_0>tawhid<a2_0/> (meaning <a4_0>"oneness" or "uniqueness"<a4_0/>). God is described in the <a3_0>Quran<a3_0/> as: "Say: He is Allah, the One and Only; Allah, the Eternal, Absolute; He begetteth not, nor is He begotten; And there is none like unto Him." Muslims repudiate the Christian doctrine of the Trinity and divinity of Jesus, <a8_0>comparing it to <a0_0><b12_0>polytheism<b12_0/><a8_0/><a0_0/>. In Islam, God is beyond all comprehension or equal and does not resemble <b13_0>any of his creations in any way<b13_0/>. Thus, Muslims are not <a1_0>iconodules<a1_0/>, and are not expected <b9_0>to visualize God<b9_0/>.
